page.title: 01BRAYDON GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Sparsely populated area with cross section of social classes and generations. Farms no longer employ labourers and rely on family members to work land and care for livestock. Established residents appreciate the community spirit but newcomers often feel isolated from people as well as amenities, of which there are virtually none. Public transport hardly exists. Private cars are relied on for getting to work, shopping and social outings. A country area such as this provides its own recreation such as fox hunting and shooting. Area comes within Braydon Forest and is of high ecological value. Main ground cover is intensively managed grassland.
